title: S.Korea Seeks Talks About Mt. Kumgang Tours
text:
The Unification Ministry on Monday proposed talks with North Korea to discuss the situation surrounding halted tours to the North's Mt. Kumgang resort.

The offer came three days after North Korea asked the South to demolish its "unsightly" buildings at the mountain resort.

North Korea is already looking to China to revive tourism to the scenic resort and may well feel it no longer needs South Korean customers.

Unification Ministry spokesman Lee Sang-min told reporters the government and Hyundai Asan, which used to run the tours, proposed "working-level talks" with North Korea at a "convenient time."
